protocol_name: CRISPR Editing of Immortalized Cell Lines with RNPs using Neon Electroporation
protocol_name_html: CRISPR Editing of Immortalized Cell Lines with RNPs using Neon Electroporation
description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"facs4","text":"This protocol describes how to deliver ribonucleoprotein (RNP) complexes that consist of purified Cas9 nuclease duplexed with chemically modified synthetic single guide RNA (sgRNA) to immortalized adherent or suspension cells. RNP delivery is accomplished using the Thermo Fisher NeonTM Transfection System. A reference for electroporation settings for a wide variety of cell types is included. A option for knock-in is included. Chemically modified sgRNAs are designed to resist exonucleases and innate intracellular immune cascades that can lead to cell death. Synthego chemically modified synthetic sgRNAs are of exceptional purity and consistently drive high editing frequencies.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":284,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

materials.reagent_name: Positive control (optional); Recommended: human RELA sgRNA, CDC42BPB sgRNA
Transfection control (optional); Recommended: pMAX GFP (Lonza), GFP mRNA (SBI)
TrypLE Express or preferred cell dissociation reagent

warning: Please refer to the SDS (Safety Data Sheet) for safety warnings and hazard information.
guidelines:
{"blocks":[{"key":"em2lj","text":"Abbreviations:
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":14,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lo3n","text":"CRISPR: clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats Cas9: CRISPR associated protein 9
sgRNA: single guide RNA
RNP: ribonucleoprotein
PCR: polymerase chain reaction
ICE: inference of CRISPR edits
FACS: fluorescence-activated cell sorting PBS: phosphate-buffered saline
TE: Tris EDTA
GFP: green fluorescent protein
  
  Important Considerations
  
Working with RNA and RNPs
Wearing gloves and using nuclease-free tubes and reagents is recommended in order to avoid RNase contamination.
Always maintain sterile technique, and use sterile, filter pipette tips.
All Synthego reagents should be stored according to the manufacturer’s recommendations.
Synthetic sgRNA should be dissolved in TE buffer and diluted to a working concentration using nuclease-free water. Please consult the Synthego Quick Start Guide for best practices related to dissolving and storing synthetic sgRNAs.
RNP complexes are stable at room temperature for up to 1 hour (may be stored at 4°C for up to one week, or at -20°C for up to 1 month). Note that RNPs stored at 4°C may become susceptible to contamination from microbial growth after long periods of time.
   
Optimized Protocols
For specific electroporation settings for your cell type, we suggest consulting the Thermo Fisher NeonTM Transfection System Protocols and Cell Line Data. Optimization of editing efficiency for a specific cell type will require empirically determining the number of cells required, amount of Cas9 and ratio of sgRNA:Cas9. This guide is meant to provide a starting point for your CRISPR editing experiments.
      
 Suggested Controls

 For technical assistance, contact our Scientific Support Team:
  
 Ph: 888.611.6883
 Email: support@synthego.com

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"am667","text":" Pre-warm 1 ml of normal growth medium in each well of a 12-well cell culture plate per reaction.\u00a0\n ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9te2h","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"2u75m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9073","amount":"1","unit":"2","label":"normal growth medium","guid":"84BBD0C52B1C4ACA9CA40F37E74F07A7"}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"0":"<","1":"p","2":">","3":"T","4":"h","5":"i","6":"s","7":" ","8":"w","9":"i","10":"l","11":"l","12":" ","13":"s","14":"e","15":"r","16":"v","17":"e","18":" ","19":"a","20":"s","21":" ","22":"t","23":"h","24":"e","25":" ","26":"d","27":"e","28":"s","29":"t","30":"i","31":"n","32":"a","33":"t","34":"i","35":"o","36":"n","37":" ","38":"p","39":"l","40":"a","41":"t","42":"e","43":" ","44":"a","45":"f","46":"t","47":"e","48":"r","49":" ","50":"e","51":"l","52":"e","53":"c","54":"t","55":"r","56":"o","57":"p","58":"o","59":"r","60":"a","61":"t","62":"i","63":"o","64":"n","65":".","66":"<","67":"\/","68":"p","69":">","blocks":[{"key":"23vbi","text":"This will serve as the destination plate after electroporation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":63,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"1BBC3C2B54A4448A94E93755F0015C88","id":655519,"previous_id":665511,"previous_guid":"D55C0A50BBAF11E8BA9BA360C31D90AD","section":"Setup & Electroporation - Prepare Destination Plate"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6d3q8","text":"Incubate RNPs for 10 minutes at room temperature.

{"blocks":[{"key":"ch2lr","text":"Neutralize the dissociation reaction with 2X volume of normal growth medium.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"AD1E5D0C1F154656987742B8C43C82D6","id":655942,"previous_id":655941,"previous_guid":"23338507958E41748452428AE52692DC","section":"Setup & Electroporation - Prepare Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"anqse","text":"Count cells to determine the cell density.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"9D96C8A288844E36BA75886DB361DDCE","id":655943,"previous_id":655942,"previous_guid":"AD1E5D0C1F154656987742B8C43C82D6","section":"Setup & Electroporation - Prepare Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59emm","text":"   Transfer 1-2 x 106 cells to a sterile microfuge tube. One tube will contain enough cells for ~10 transfections.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":20,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnbmr","text":"   Centrifuge cells for 5 minutes at 500 x g. Aspirate medium.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"27ju1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"18379","duration":"300","label":"Centrifugation","guid":"EBC8DF2AE920447E9BFB2ED8DB9CFE4F"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8u9i","text":"   Wash the cells once with 1X PBS.

{"blocks":[{"key":"cs1gb","text":" Add 5 μl of cell suspension to each RNP solution (7 μl) to make 12 μl of cell-RNP solution per reaction.

{"blocks":[{"key":"s3e2","text":" Aspirate 10 μl of cell-RNP solution to a 10 μl Neon tip.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3tlph","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9108","amount":"10","unit":"1","label":"cell-RNP solution","guid":"6D0F891AD7BA492B882E02D63F27AFA3"}}],"guid":"558F866A2B324E038EDB7995713ACA72","id":655950,"previous_id":655949,"previous_guid":"D6B1609A80564CF6B217A75D6C731301","section":"Setup & Electroporation - Transfect Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnc5h","text":"Immediately transfer cells to a pre-warmed 12-well plate (prepared in step 2).

The recommended length of each homology arm is at least 50 bp. Add 1 \u00b5l 60 \u00b5M ssDNA HDR Template per reaction to each well. Optimization may be required. To knock in larger inserts and for more information on designing knock-in experiments, see Tips and Tricks: Design and Optimization of CRISPR Knock-in Experiments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":17,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":334,"length":71,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4082CE80BBB111E8BA9BA360C31D90AD","url":"https:\/\/www.synthego.com\/resources\/designing-crispr-knock-in-experiments"}}]}}],"guid":"7EDAD930BBB011E8BA9BA360C31D90AD","id":665513,"previous_id":655519,"previous_guid":"D55C0A50BBAF11E8BA9BA360C31D90AD","section":"Setup & Electroporation - Assemble RNP Complexes (9:1 sgRNA to Cas9 ratio)"}
